intro: Cavendishia urbaniana, commonly known as the urbaniana orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, and colorful flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in clusters, often displaying a mix of white, pink, and purple hues, making it a visually appealing ornamental plant.
